Name: Dashboard Confirmed Exoplanets
Description: I designed and implemented a Streamlit dashboard to facilitate the analysis of confirmed exoplanet data. Utilized PostgreSQL for efficient data retrieval and filtering to support targeted exploration. Applied Python and Pandas for robust data cleaning and transformation. The resulting interactive dashboard provides comprehensive visualizations of exoplanet properties (distribution, radius, mass, orbital period, eccentricity), empowering users to dynamically filter data. This project highlights the application of data science techniques – including SQL querying, data preprocessing, and interactive visualization – to address a real-world challenge in astronomical observation planning, where resource optimization (telescope time) is critical. See complete project on my GitHub.
Knowledge: Data Visualization,Data Preparation,Data Analysis,Data Transformation,Data Cleaning

Name: Dashboard Exoplanets
Description: I developed a Power BI dashboard to visualize the distribution and detection methods of exoplanets across various confirmation statuses (Confirmed, Candidates, Controversial, Retracted, Unconfirmed). The dashboard enables exploration of key planetary properties (mass, radius, orbital period) by status and discovery method, facilitating the identification of effective detection techniques. This project showcases skills in data visualization, exploratory data analysis, and leveraging business intelligence tools to derive insights relevant to resource allocation in astronomical observation (e.g., Kepler, James Webb). Initial data exploration was conducted using PostgreSQL.
Knowledge: Data Visualization,Data Analysis,Data Transformation,Data Cleaning,Data Preparation,Statistics

Name: Distributions map of earthquakes in Mexico
Description: I analyzed a comprehensive dataset of earthquakes in Mexico (1900 to present) using Python and Pandas for data manipulation and exploration. Visualized earthquake distributions on a Mexican map using libraries such as GeoPandas, Plotly, and Matplotlib to identify high-density zones and spatial patterns. This project showcases skills in data analysis, geospatial visualization, and leveraging Python libraries for insightful pattern recognition.
Knowledge: Data Visualization,Data Preparation,Data Analysis,Data Cleaning,Data Transformation,Statistics

Name: Mexico Crime Analysis Dashboard (Power BI)
Description: I developed a Power BI dashboard analyzing crime data in Mexico (ENVIPE, INEGI, 2019). Visualized the distribution of various crime types across Mexican states, identifying high-crime areas. This project demonstrates skills in data visualization, business intelligence, and the ability to derive actionable insights for potential security strategies.

Name: Power BI Dashboard for Sales Data Analysis
Description: I developed an interactive Power BI dashboard to visualize key sales metrics for a company. Provides comprehensive insights into total sales, regional performance, individual salesperson contributions, and product-level sales analysis.

Name: Interactive Science Quiz Application
Description: I created an interactive science quiz game leveraging HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The application presents five multiple-choice questions, provides real-time feedback on answer accuracy, and calculates a final score. This project showcases foundational programming skills and the ability to build engaging user interfaces, with potential for future integration of data analysis on user performance.
Knowledge: Front-End Development,Web Development Fundamentals,Interactive Application Development
